source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第五十二
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 52

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏闍那崛多譯
translation: Sui Tianzhu Tripiṭaka Jñānagupta Translation

source_sentence: 優陀夷因緣品第五十四上
translation: Udāyin, Chapter 54 on Causes and Conditions

source_sentence: 爾時，佛復告舍利弗作如是言：「汝舍利弗！
translation: At that point, the Buddha again addressed Śāriputra and said in this way, "You, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 我今當行遊歷國土，初欲往到本自生地微妙之處，亦當如是。」
translation: Now, when I first wish to travel to a land that is a marvelous place of its own birth, I will do likewise."

source_sentence: 時舍利弗，即從坐起，整理衣服，偏袒右臂，合掌向佛，而作是言：「世尊！
translation: Śāriputra then rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, bared his right arm, put his palms together, and addressed the Buddha, saying, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何時當欲遊歷國土觀看聚落？」
translation: When will you want to travel through the land and look at the villages?"

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告舍利弗言：「汝舍利弗！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śāriputra, saying, "You, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 我於今月，過半月已，布薩事訖，然後當行遊歷國土。」
translation: Half a month has passed since I finished preaching this month, and then I'll travel through the lands."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊過彼半月布薩已訖，與諸比丘，涉歷諸國。
translation: After he had finished preaching for the past half month, the Bhagavān traveled with the monks through the lands.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊至王舍城，飯食已訖，迴還以足蹋城門閫，時彼大地六種震動，動已復動，涌已復涌。
translation: When the Bhagavān reached the city of Rājagṛha and finished his meal, he returned and placed his foot against the city gate, when the earth shook in six ways, stirred again after moving, and welled up again after welling up.

source_sentence: 時摩伽陀彼國之王頻婆娑羅，與諸人眾，俱詣佛所，即隨佛行，遊涉諸國觀看聚落。
translation: Then King Bimbisāra of that country of Magadha, along with a group of people, went to the Buddha and followed his steps, traveling through the countries and observing the villages.

source_sentence: 時虛空中，無量諸天千億萬眾，見佛將欲遊歷國土，皆來集會，歡喜踊躍，遍滿其體，不能自勝，口出種種微妙音聲，歌嘯喜樂，呼唱大喚，旋裾舞袖，拂弄天衣。
translation: When measureless hundreds of millions of gods in the sky saw that the Buddha was about to travel to their lands, they all rallied, rejoiced, and jumped for joy, filling their bodies so much that they couldn't contain themselves, making all kinds of exquisite sounds, singing and rejoicing, shouting and calling out, twirling their trains and dancing their sleeves, and flicking their heavenly robes.

source_sentence: 復以天上優鉢羅華、拘物頭華、波頭摩華、分陀利華，以散佛上。
translation: He then spreads the heavenly blue lotus, the white lotus, the white lotus, and the white lotus on top of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 復持種種末香塗香及香華鬘，亦散佛上，散已復散。
translation: He also carried a variety of fragrant incense and flower garlands, which he scattered on top of the Buddha, and then he scattered them again afterward.

source_sentence: 時，婆伽婆所行至處，觀看諸國，一切眾類，皆悉恭敬，尊重供養。
translation: When he arrived, the Bhagavān looked around the countries and all the various people there were respectful and offered their offerings.

source_sentence: 如來到處，得諸衣服，最勝最妙，飲食湯藥床褥臥具，如是資物不可稱計，利養殊妙無所乏少，名聞流布遍滿世間。
translation: When the Buddha arrived, he was provided with clothing that was the finest and most marvelous, food and drink, medicine, bedding, and other necessities that could not be calculated, benefits that were marvelous and not lacking, and fame and renown that spread throughout the world.

source_sentence: 而佛於此名聞利養，不生染著，猶如蓮華處於濁水。
translation: Here, however, the Buddha's attachment to fame, learning, and profit doesn't become defiled, just like a lotus flower in turbid water.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊有如是等無量威德，於諸世間，威德最勝，殊妙第一。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had measureless virtues like these, the most authoritative and marvelous of all the worlds.

source_sentence: 時婆伽婆、多他阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，此世彼世，若天若魔、梵沙門等，及婆羅門，諸天人境，以神通智皆悉證知。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Ārāha, the Samyak-saṃbuddha, the Perfection of Knowledge and Conduct, the Well-Gone, the Understander of the World, the Unsurpassed One, the Trainer, the Teacher of Gods and People, the Buddha, and the Bhagavān were all fully realized with supernormal knowledge by gods, Māra, Brahmā, ascetics, and priests, as well as the celestial and human realms in this and that world.

source_sentence: 而彼世尊，為世說法，辭義巧妙，初中後善，悉令具足清淨梵行。
translation: That Bhagavān teaches the Dharma for the world with skillful speech and meaning, and it's good in the beginning and end, making it possible to fully purify the religious practice.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知諸眾生堪受化者即教化之，宜建立者教令建立，隨其住處便得成就，應受三歸授三歸法，應受五戒授與五戒，應受八關齋戒之法即授八關齋戒之法，應受十善授十善法，應出家者令得出家，應受具戒授具足戒。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān knew that sentient beings who were suitable for transformation were taught and educated, those who were suitable for establishment were taught and made to establish themselves, and those who followed their abodes were accomplished, were given the three refuge teachings when they should accept the three refuge teachings, the five precepts when they should accept the five precepts, the eight precepts when they should accept the eight precepts, the ten good teachings when they should accept the ten good teachings, those who should leave home were made to leave home, and the full precepts when they should accept the full precepts were given.

source_sentence: 如是次第，展轉漸進，至迦毘羅婆蘇都城園林而住。
translation: In this order, he gradually progressed to the garden of Kapilavastu and stayed there.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊至迦毘羅婆蘇都城，住尼拘陀樹林園內，而以偈說遊歷國土勝妙之事：「釋種如來大師子，　　瞿曇最勝威德者，　往觀城邑及聚落，　　悉有廣大諸異相。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān went to the capital city of Kapilavastu and stayed in the Nirgrantha Grove, where he spoke in verse about the wonders of traveling through the land, "The Śakra Tathāgata, the great teacher and son of the Gautama, the most authoritative one, goes to see cities and towns and villages that all have vast and varied appearances.

source_sentence: 所欲至於村聚落，　　往見如來大聖師，　處處一切諸人眾，　　恭敬尊嚴來迎奉。
translation: When he wants to go to a village or a hamlet, he goes to see the Tathāgata's great sage teacher, and everywhere he goes, all the people there are respectful and dignified, and they come to greet him.

source_sentence: 所欲至於村聚落，　　往見如來大聖師，　凡是一切諸華樹，　　悉各傾向世尊所。
translation: Whenever he wants to go to a village or a town, he goes to see the Tathāgata's great sage teacher, and all the flowering trees tend to the Bhagavān's place.

source_sentence: 至於一切林樹下，　　世尊若立若止息，　是樹自然雨其華，　　遍布其地悉充滿。
translation: When the Bhagavān stands or stands still underneath all the trees, the trees naturally rain down their flowers, and the ground is completely filled with them.

source_sentence: 所至一切林樹下，　　世尊於中若止住，　是樹甘果自然落，　　枝葉婀娜悉低垂。
translation: If the Bhagavān stands still underneath any forest tree that he reaches, the tree's sweet fruit naturally falls, and its branches and leaves all hang down gracefully.

source_sentence: 有樹人所攀及者，　　華果紛雜自可憐，　瞿曇如來大聖師，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: There are trees that people climb and reach, and they are filled with flowers and fruits that are pitiable. The Gautama Tathāgata, the great sage teacher, travels around and experiences such things.

source_sentence: 樹有人所不及者，　　妙華甘果自然落，　瞿曇雄猛大聖師，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: When a tree falls short of a person, the marvelous flowers and sweet fruit naturally fall, and the Gautama Tathāgata is a great sage teacher whose wanderings should be felt like this.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨華名曰薑迦羅，　瞿曇雄猛大聖師，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: "The gods are in the sky, and it rains flowers named kaṅkara, so the Gautama's heroic and noble teacher wanders about and experiences such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨華名曰曼殊沙，　瞿曇雄猛大聖師，　　威德應感如是事。
translation: The gods are in space, and it rains flowers named mañjūṣaka, the Gautama's heroic and noble teacher, whose prowess should be felt like this.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨於雜種妙色華，　瞿曇雄猛大世尊，　　威神應感如是事。
translation: While the gods are in space, they rain flowers of various marvelous colors, and the Gautama is heroic and mighty, the great sage teacher, whose authority and spirit should be felt as such.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨華名曰曼陀羅，　瞿曇雄猛大聖師，　　威德應感如是事。
translation: While the gods are in space, they rain flowers named maṇḍalas, and the Gautama is a heroic and noble teacher whose mighty prowess should be felt in this way.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨華名曰波利耶，　瞿曇雄猛大聖尊，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: While the gods are in space, it rains flowers named Bolyai, the great sage Gautama Kumārajīva, whose travels should bring about such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨華名曰毘婆伽，　瞿曇師子大聖師，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: "The gods are in space, and it rains flowers named Bhīvaka, the great sage teacher of the Gautama's lion, whose travels should cause such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨華名曰香勝香，　瞿曇師子天人尊，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: "The gods are in space, and it rains flowers named fragrant incense, the Gautama Shizi gods and humans, so their travels should be felt as such.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨於種種妙香華，　瞿曇大聖人天眼，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: While the gods are in space, they rain down flowers of wonderful fragrance, and the Gautama gods and divine eyes of sages should experience such things as these when they wander about.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨華名曰普至香，　瞿曇雄猛大聖尊，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space, they rain flowers named Puṣyaprabha, the Gautama's heroic and great sage gods, and their wanderings are cause for such revelation.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨於微妙金色華，　瞿曇雄猛大聖師，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space, they rain flowers of subtle gold, and the Gautama Kumārajīva, the great sage teacher, travels about and experiences such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨諸微妙寶色華，　瞿曇十力大聖尊，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: "The gods are in the sky, raining down flowers of subtle jewels, and the Gautama is a great sage of ten powers, so their prowls should bring about such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨諸妙色寶莖華，　瞿曇雄猛人天眼，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: While the gods are in space, they rain down flowers of marvelously colored jewels and stems, and the Gautama's heroic human and divine eye travels about and experiences such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨優鉢羅微妙花，　瞿曇雄猛天人師，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: "The gods are in space, and it rains down subtle flowers, so the Gautama's heroic celestials and human teachers should experience such things as these when they wander about.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨於沈水妙香末，　瞿曇三界天人尊，　　威德應感如是事。
translation: While the gods are in space, they rain down the fine fragrant residue of submerged water, and the Gautama gods and men of the three realms are honored with such an undertaking as their prowess should lead them to believe.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨赤栴檀妙香末，　瞿曇師子大聖師，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: While the gods are in space, they rain down the fine fragrance of red sandalwood, and the Gautama lion, the great sage teacher, causes his travels to be felt as such.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨於牛頭妙香末，　瞿曇雄猛大世尊，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: When the gods are in the sky, they rain down the fine fragrance of oxhead, and the Gautama Mahārāja, the great sage teacher, prowls about and is made to feel such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　奏作種種諸天樂，　瞿曇威猛大聖尊，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: While the gods are in space, they create all kinds of celestial music, and the Gautama is a mighty and powerful great sage whose travels should be felt as such.

source_sentence: 非人在於虛空裏，　　拂弄種種妙天衣，　瞿曇師子大聖師，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: When non-humans are in space, they are flicking various kinds of wonderful heavenly garments, and the Gautama's lion, the great sage teacher, makes his travels feel like this.

source_sentence: 諸天隨順佛行路，　　悉持種種妙香華，　為彼大聖天中天，　　隨路雨華恒至膝，　彼時無寒復無熱，　　種種蚊虻諸惡蟲，　微妙大聖天中尊，　　應感能招如是事。
translation: The gods follow the Buddha's path, each carrying a variety of wonderfully fragrant flowers, for which the gods of the great sage gods rain flowers up to their knees along the path, when it's neither cold nor hot, and there are various mosquitoes and stinging insects, the most honored of the subtle great sage gods should be able to bring about such things.

source_sentence: 一切大地皆平正，　　山陵堆阜悉坦然，　瞿曇十力大聖尊，　　遊行感應如是事。
translation: All the earth is level and straight, the hills and mountains are smooth, and the Gautama, the most noble of the ten powers, travels about sensing such things.

source_sentence: 一切大地甚清淨，　　無有惡刺諸荊棘，　瞿曇威德天人尊，　　遊行應感如是事。
translation: All the earth is perfectly pure, devoid of thorns and thorns, and Gautama is honored among gods and humans for his authoritative power, so his travels bring about such things.

source_sentence: 一切大地微徐動，　　并大巨海及諸山，　瞿曇三界無上尊，　　遊行感應如是事。
translation: All the earth moves slightly, and there's a huge ocean and mountains, so the Gautama, the unsurpassed honored one of the three realms, perceives such things when he travels.

source_sentence: 一切剎利婆羅門，　　并及毘舍首陀等，　其數千萬有千萬，　　恒共如來相隨逐。
translation: All the bhadras, Brahmans, Vaiśravaṇas, and others, some ten million to ten million in number, are constantly accompanied by the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 復有地居妙勝天，　　有諸色力大威嚴，　瞿曇雄猛大世尊，　　行住坐立相隨逐。
translation: There's another earth-dwelling, marvelous god with form and power and great dignity, the Gautama, the heroic Bhagavān, who follows him as he walks, stands, sits, and stands up.

source_sentence: 復有護世四天王，　　並大威力最勝者，　瞿曇微妙大聖尊，　　行住坐立相隨逐。
translation: There's also the four heavenly guardian kings, the most powerful of them all, the Gautama, the most subtle and noble of them all, who follows them as they walk, sit, and stand.

source_sentence: 須彌山頂帝釋王，　　及以梵王娑婆主，　瞿曇奇特最勝尊，　　恒共如是相隨逐。
translation: The Śubhakṛtsna king on the summit of Mt. Sumeru, the Brahma king Saṃbhavā, and the Gautama, the most extraordinary and honored of them all, are constantly following each other like this.

source_sentence: 復有欲界諸天眾，　　及以色界四禪等，　瞿曇威猛大聖尊，　　恒共如是相隨逐。
translation: "Furthermore, there are the gods of the desire realm and the four meditation heavens of the form realm, and the Gautama is a mighty and great sage who constantly follows each other like this.

source_sentence: 復有諸龍金翅鳥，　　揵闥婆等阿修羅，　夜叉及以羅剎眾，　　皆共隨逐如來行。
translation: There are also dragons, garuḍas, gandharvas, asuras, yakṣas, and rājas who all walk together in pursuit of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 世間所有眾生類，　　已說及以不說者，　悉逐雄猛瞿曇師，　　遊歷國土及城邑。
translation: All the world's sentient beings, both those who have spoken and those who haven't spoken, follow the majestic Gautama teacher as he travels through lands and cities.

source_sentence: 世尊如是遊行時，　　教化無量人天等，　憐愍所生親族故，　　今至本城迦毘羅。」
translation: When the Bhagavān thus marched, he taught measureless humans and gods alike, and now he's arrived in our city, Kapilavastu, out of pity for the families he's born to."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老優陀夷及以長老車匿，二人俱詣佛所，頂禮佛足，却住一面。
translation: At the time, Udāyin the Elder and Chandaka the Elder both went to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 時二長老白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The two elders then said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王曾無信心，有不淨心，乃至不欲見諸比丘。」
translation: King Shourdan had no faith and an impure mind, so much so that he didn't want to see the monks."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知是事故，告諸比丘，作如是言：「諸比丘等！
translation: Knowing this, the Bhagavān addressed the monks and said, "Monks!

source_sentence: 誰能往詣輸頭檀王所，至已教化，令其信敬？」
translation: Who can go to King Śuddhodana and teach him to be faithful and respectful after arriving?"

source_sentence: 爾時，眾中有一比丘，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, a monk in the crowd said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此長老舍利弗者，堪能往詣輸頭檀王所，方便教化令其信敬。」
translation: Now, the elder Śāriputra can go to King Śuddhodana and skillfully teach him to be faithful and respectful."

source_sentence: 或有比丘白言：「世尊！
translation: Some monks said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此長老目揵連者，堪能往詣輸頭檀王所，方便教化令其信敬。」
translation: Now, this elder Maudgalyāyana can go to King Śuddhodana and skillfully teach him to be faithful and respectful."

source_sentence: 或有比丘白言：「世尊！
translation: Some monks said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此長老摩訶迦葉，堪能教化令其信敬。」
translation: Now, this elder Mahākāśyapa is capable of teaching and making them believe and respect him."

source_sentence: 或有比丘白言：「世尊！
translation: Some monks said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此長老大迦旃延，堪能教化令其信敬。」
translation: Now, this elder Kātyāyana is capable of teaching and making them believe and respect him."

source_sentence: 或有比丘白言：「世尊！
translation: Some monks said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此眾中，長老優樓頻蠡迦葉，堪能教化令其信敬。」
translation: Among these people, the elder Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa is able to teach them and make them believe and respect him."

source_sentence: 或有比丘白言：「世尊！
translation: Some monks said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此眾中，那提迦葉，堪能教化令其信敬。」
translation: Among them all, Nadī-Kāśyapa is the one who can teach and make them believe and respect him."

source_sentence: 或有比丘白言：「世尊！
translation: Some monks said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此長老優波斯那，堪能往詣輸頭檀王所，方便教化令其信敬。」
translation: Now, this elder Upāsaka could go to King Śuddhodana and skillfully teach him to be faithful and respectful."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告優陀夷，作如是言：「優陀夷！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Udayin and said, "Udayin!

source_sentence: 汝於今者，頗能往詣輸頭檀王所，到已教化令信敬不？」
translation: Now, will you go to King Gṛdhrakūṭa and teach him to be faithful when you arrive?"

source_sentence: 時優陀夷白言：「世尊！
translation: Udāyin then said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今堪能。」
translation: Now, I'm capable of doing it."

source_sentence: 佛即告言：「汝優陀夷！
translation: The Buddha then told them, "You, Udayin!

source_sentence: 汝今往詣輸頭檀王所，方便教化令其信敬。」
translation: Now, go to King Śuddhodana and teach him skillfully so that he'll believe and respect you."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老優陀夷者聞佛世尊如是語已，而白佛言：「唯然世尊！
translation: After hearing the Bhagavān say this, the elder Udāyin said to the Buddha, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如佛所教，不敢違也。」
translation: Just as the Buddha taught, I dare not disobey him."

source_sentence: 時，優陀夷於其晨朝，日始初出，著衣持鉢，往詣向彼輸頭檀王宮。
translation: At the time, Udayinī gathered his robe and bowl in the early morning hours when the sun first rose and went to the palace of King Śuddhodana.

source_sentence: 到已問彼守門人言：「仁者應知！
translation: When he arrived, he asked the gatekeeper, "Sir, you should know this!

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王今在何許？」
translation: Where is King Śuddhodana now?"

source_sentence: 彼人報言：「王今在殿治理王務。」
translation: Those people reported, "The king is now in the palace tending to the king's business."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老優陀夷往至輸頭檀王之所，在於一廂默然而住。
translation: At the time, Udāyin the Elder went to King Śuddhodana's residence and stayed in one compartment in silence.

source_sentence: 爾時，左右諸大臣等，見優陀夷在一邊已，即告四門諸守人言：「速往斷此出家之人，勿令在此，致使王見起發惡心。」
translation: When the ministers to his left and right saw Udāyin at one side, they told the four gatekeepers, "Quickly go and stop this renunciant from being here and causing the king to see him and become ill-willed."

source_sentence: 其守門人，聞大臣命，速往至彼優陀夷邊欲驅令出。
translation: When the gatekeepers heard the minister's order, they quickly went to Udāyin and tried to get him to leave.

source_sentence: 時守門人，見已始知是國師子，昔時恒共太子悉達，少小朋遊拊塵之戲，不忍驅逐，而復迴還。
translation: After he saw him, the gatekeeper realized that he was the national lion who had been with Prince Siddhârtha as a young boy, playing in the dust, and couldn't bear to drive him away, but he returned.

source_sentence: 時諸大臣，問守門人，作如是言：「汝等何故不驅如此出家人？」
translation: The ministers then asked the gatekeeper, "Why didn't you expel this monk?"

source_sentence: 即時守門人，報諸臣等，作如是言：「其人乃是國師之子，從生已來，悉達太子，交故朋親，拊塵之好，是故我等不忍驅遣。」
translation: The gatekeeper then reported to the ministers, saying, "That man is the son of the national teacher, who has been Prince Siddhârtha since birth, has close friends and associates, and is too good for us to send away."

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王在殿料理事訖，起欲還閤，諸大臣等左右圍遶，將入宮內。
translation: When King Śuddhodana finished his business in the palace and rose to return to the retreat, he was surrounded by ministers and others who were about to enter the palace.

source_sentence: 時，優陀夷速往直至輸頭檀王所，執其王手。
translation: Udāyin then quickly went up to King Śuddhodana and took his hand.

source_sentence: 當於爾時，輸頭檀王默然不語，作如是念：「我今若語，恐守門人，驅令出去。」
translation: At that point, King Śuddhodana remained silent and had this thought, "If I speak now, I'm afraid the gatekeeper will expel me."

source_sentence: 其守門人，復作是念：「諸大臣輩，自應驅遣。」
translation: The gatekeeper then again thought, "The ministers themselves should be driven out."

source_sentence: 其諸大臣，復作是念：「宮門內人，當應遮却。」
translation: Those ministers then thought, "The people inside the palace gate should be kept away."

source_sentence: 宮門內人，復作是念：「此人本是輸頭檀王，恒所愛念，如今還復執手而行。」
translation: Those inside the palace gate then again thought, "This person was once King Śuddhodana and was always loved by him, but now he's still holding his hand and walking around."

source_sentence: 爾時，各作如是念故，無有一人能驅遣者。
translation: At the time, they each thought this, and there was no one who could drive him away.

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王漸進入宮，昇其內殿，坐師子座。
translation: King Śuddhodana then gradually entered the palace, ascended to his inner sanctum, and sat down on his lion's seat.

source_sentence: 時，優陀夷見淨飯王入彼宮內昇其殿已，優陀夷亦上其殿，去王不遠在前而立。
translation: When Udāyin saw King Jīvaka enter the palace and ascend to his inner sanctum, Udāyin also ascended to his palace, stood in front of the king not far from him, and was present.

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王見優陀夷相去不遠在前立已，即生煩惱，出微細聲，作如是言：「嗚呼苦哉！
translation: Seeing Udāyin standing in front of him not far from him, King Śuddhodana became troubled and made a small noise, saying, "Oh, my, this is painful!

source_sentence: 我子形容，如此枯悴，可厭惡也。
translation: My son's appearance is so withered, it's disgusting.

source_sentence: 汝等速驅此出家人，阿誰聽入使來此也？」
translation: You must quickly expel this monk. Who will listen to the messengers who enter here?"

source_sentence: 時諸大臣白言：「大王！
translation: The ministers then said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 如臣等見，是事不然。
translation: As I've seen, this is not the case.

source_sentence: 大王不應驅此人出。
translation: The king shouldn't have driven this man out.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此人既是國師之子，復是悉達小來朋伴拊塵遊戲。」
translation: This man is the son of the national teacher, and he's also a companion of Siddhârtha's men who plays with the dust."

source_sentence: 時，優陀夷言辭哀愍，不令傷損淨飯王意，而說偈言：「[矢*見]求穀實故犁種，　　貪覓寶貨入於海，　我意今來貪住此，　　唯願其事速成就。
translation: Udāyin then spoke compassionately, not wishing to harm King Jīvaka's intentions, and spoke in verse, "[vector*view] Seeking the grain truth, he plows the seeds, desiring precious goods that enter the sea.

source_sentence: 如此道路常吉利，　　於諸無畏常安隱，　欲至諸方求利者，　　必使瞿曇利得成。
translation: The path is always fortunate, the fearlessness is always secure, and those who want to go to different places for profit will surely find success with the Gautama.

source_sentence: 數數諸人耕其地，　　數數於中散種子，　數數諸天下甘雨，　　數數國內五穀成。
translation: Countless men plow their fields, countless seeds are scattered among them, countless heavens rain sweetly, and countless countries produce five grains.

source_sentence: 數數乞士恒常乞，　　數數施主恒常施，　數數此世行檀那，　　數數天上獲其果。
translation: Countless are the beggars who always beg, and countless are the givers who always give; countless are the donations practiced in this world, and countless are the fruits obtained in the heavens.

source_sentence: 數數牸牛搆得乳，　　數數犢子向母邊，　數數婦人懷胎藏，　　數數生產受諸苦。
translation: Countless are the milk given to the cow, countless are the calves that go to their mothers, countless are the wombs of women who are pregnant and hidden, and countless are the sufferings of childbirth.

source_sentence: 數數死屍向寒林，　　數數諸親悲啼送，　若得聖道無後有，　　於煩惱中不受生。」
translation: Countless dead corpses go to the cold forest, and countless relatives lament and send them off. If they attain the noble path and have no subsequent existence, they won't be subject to birth in the midst of affliction."

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王聞優陀夷作如是等哀愍語已，猶懷小疑，尋復重問優陀夷言：「尊者本於誰邊出家，大師是誰？」
translation: After hearing these kind words of compassion from Udayin, King Śuddhodana still had minor doubts and asked Udayin again, "Venerable, from whom did you first leave home, and who is your teacher?"

source_sentence: 時，優陀夷說偈以報淨飯王言：「師父名曰輸頭檀，　　所生尊母名摩耶，　懷在胎中經十月，　　生已母終生忉利。
translation: Udāyin then spoke a verse in response to King Jīvaka, saying, "My father's name is Śuddhodana, and the venerable mother he gave birth to is named Māyā, who was conceived in the womb for ten months and whose mother ended up in Trāyastriṃśa after birth.

source_sentence: 如是聖者生汝家，　　大德大聖天中天，　彼家七世已濟拔，　　名聞處處皆流布。
translation: Thus was the noble one born into your family, a great virtuous and holy god among gods, whose family has been saved for seven generations and whose reputation is spread everywhere.

source_sentence: 丈夫人中最希有，　　於一切處不受生，　所生如是大聖者，　　其家恒受大安樂。
translation: Rare among men, he's not born in any place, but such a great sage is born, and his family always experiences great happiness.

source_sentence: 釋種親族最名稱，　　尊生百福莊嚴身，　如是釋子天中勝，　　我於彼邊出家者。」
translation: The most famous of the Śākya clan is born to a noble one with a body adorned with a hundred merits, and such is the Śākyamuni son who's superior among gods and whose family I left at the other end."

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王復問長老優陀夷言：「善哉比丘！
translation: It was then that King Śuddhodana again asked the elder Udāyin, "Good, monks!

source_sentence: 汝實誰邊而得出家？
translation: "Whose side did you really come from and leave home?

source_sentence: 而彼人師，頗有正信及能正意行梵行不？
translation: Will those human masters have right faith and be able to correctly practice the religious practice?

source_sentence: 在阿蘭若空閑樹下坐意樂不？」
translation: Do you enjoy sitting under the forest tree in Araṇya?"

source_sentence: 爾時，長老優陀夷以偈復報輸頭檀王，作如是言：「王問誰邊出家者，　　彼人正信行梵行，　無有方所懷憂怖，　　在於樹下常受樂。
translation: It was then that the elder Udāyin reprimanded King Śuddhodana in verse, saying, "The king asks who's the next renunciant, that person who correctly believes and practices the religious life, has no place to go that's frightening, and is always happy under a tree.

source_sentence: 不畏他聲猶師子，　　不被羅網如猛風，　教授他人自無學，　　拔諸恐怖身不怖。」
translation: He doesn't fear other voices like a lion, isn't caught in a net like a fierce wind, teaches others about himself and has no training, and extracts fear from those who are afraid."

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王復問長老優陀夷言：「如是比丘！
translation: King Śuddhodana then asked the elder Udāyin, "Thus, monks!

source_sentence: 今在何處？」
translation: Where is it now?"

source_sentence: 優陀夷言：「如大王問，然彼多他伽多、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，今已在此迦毗羅城尼俱陀林。」
translation: Udāyin said, "As the king asked, that Tathāgata, Ārāha, and Samyak-saṃbuddha are now here in the Nigrodha Grove of Kapilavastu."

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王即作是念：「此優陀夷，乃是我兒之弟子也。」
translation: King Śuddhodana then had this thought, "This Udāyin is my son's disciple."

source_sentence: 以是因緣，告諸大臣，作如是言：「卿等今可請此比丘，在座安坐。」
translation: For this reason, he addressed his ministers and said, "Now, you may invite this monk to sit down at your seat."

source_sentence: 其諸大臣聞王勅已白言：「大王！
translation: After hearing the king's order, the ministers said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 不敢違背。」
translation: I dare not disobey."

source_sentence: 即請長老優陀夷坐。
translation: He then invited the elder Udāyin to sit down.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王復勅諸臣：「卿等將食與此比丘。」
translation: The king of Jīvaka then commanded his ministers, "Give this monk some food."

source_sentence: 諸臣得勅，即持淨水，與優陀夷，澡洗手已，即將飯食授優陀夷。
translation: When the ministers received the command, they brought Udāyin pure water, washed his hands, and then gave Udāyin the food.

source_sentence: 時優陀夷得此食已，而不自食，欲將此食奉獻世尊。
translation: After he received this food, Udayin didn't eat it himself but wanted to offer it to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王遂問長老優陀夷言：「比丘何故不食此食？」
translation: King Śuddhodana then asked the elder Udāyin, "Why didn't the monk eat this food?"

source_sentence: 優陀夷言：「此食擬將奉獻世尊，是故不食。」
translation: Udayin said, "I intend to serve this food to the Bhagavān, so I won't eat it."

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王心復懊惱，涕淚橫流，而作是言：「嗚呼我子！
translation: Being distressed, King Jīvaka burst into tears and said, "Aah! My son!

source_sentence: 身體柔軟，昔在宮內，恒受快樂，身無諸苦，今日何故受如此困？
translation: "My body is flexible. In the past, I was always happy in the palace and experienced no suffering in my body; why is I so trapped today?

source_sentence: 乃使比丘乞得食已，爾乃方食。」
translation: After asking the monk to obtain food, then he would eat it."

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王作是語已，悲啼哽咽，復告優陀夷，作如是言：「比丘今者，但食此食，我今更為別取飯食，將與汝師。」
translation: After he said this, the king of Jīvaka became sad and choked up, and then he again told Udayinī, "Now, monks, you've only eaten this food; now, I'll get another meal for you and give it to your teacher."

source_sentence: 時優陀夷復白王言：「如是大王！
translation: Udāyin then again said to the king, "So it is, great king!

source_sentence: 此食已擬奉獻世尊，此食世間所有眾生，無能消者。
translation: This food is intended for the Bhagavān, and there's no sentient being in the world who can consume it.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 然彼世尊，戒行最勝，禪定最勝，智慧亦勝。」
translation: Nevertheless, that Bhagavān is the most excellent in terms of his moral conduct, the most excellent in terms of his meditation, and the most excellent in terms of his wisdom."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王告諸大臣，作如是言：「卿等今者更取餘食，與此比丘，令其食已，速將此食，送彼大子。」
translation: The king of Jīvaka then addressed his ministers and said, "Now, you may take some other food and give it to this monk, so that after he eats it, he'll quickly send it to his eldest son."

source_sentence: 諸臣即時，更將別食與優陀夷。
translation: The ministers then gave Udāyin the other food.

source_sentence: 時，優陀夷飯食已訖，而白王言：「如是大王！
translation: When Udayinī had finished his meal, he said to the king, "So it is, Great King!

source_sentence: 如來、世尊、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，如是王者及諸人眾，無量無邊，皆來恭敬。
translation: The Tathāgata, the Bhagavān, Ālāha, and Samantabhadra, such kings, and a multitude of people, numberless and limitless, all come to venerate them.

source_sentence: 然今大王！
translation: But now, great king!

source_sentence: 亦應宜往到於彼處。」
translation: It would be appropriate for him to go there."

source_sentence: 作是語已，從座而起欲出宮。
translation: After he said this, he got up from his seat and wanted to leave the palace.

source_sentence: 時輸頭檀王復白長老優陀夷言：「尊者於先至悉達所，作如是言：『我今不久欲來見汝。』」
translation: King Śuddhodana then again said to Udāyin, the elder, "Venerable, when you first came to Siddhârtha, you said this, 'I'm going to come to see you soon.'"

source_sentence: 優陀夷言：「敬如王命。」
translation: Udāyin said, 'Respectfully, as the king ordered.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，長老優陀夷即持彼食，從城而出，至尼俱陀樹林之內，至佛所已白言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Udāyin the Elder took this food and left the city, went to the forest of the Nigrodha trees, and went to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王，我已教化令得歡喜，欲來見佛。」
translation: King Śuddhodana, I have taught and made you rejoice, and you want to come to see the Buddha."

source_sentence: 其優陀夷從宮出時，須臾之間，其輸頭檀王勅諸大臣，作如是言：「卿等知時，悉達太子已至此城，我等今者當作何事？」
translation: When Udāyin left the palace, in a moment's time, King Śuddhodana commanded his ministers, saying, "You know that Prince Siddhârtha has arrived in this city, so what should we do now?"

source_sentence: 諸大臣言：「善哉大王！
translation: The ministers said, "Good, great king!

source_sentence: 若更有別餘沙門來到王所者，我等尚須供養供給，況復今者悉達太子，與我等身，無異無別，豈得安然不生恭敬？
translation: If other ascetics were to come to the king, we would still have to make offerings and make sacrifices, so how could we not be at ease and venerate Prince Siddhârtha, who is no different from or distinct from us?

source_sentence: 我等但護大王心意，未至彼耳。」
translation: We're just guarding the king's thoughts; we haven't gone there yet."

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王勅令振鐸普告城內，悉使知聞：「我今欲至悉達太子往觀彼處，汝等各各備辦莊嚴，隨從於我(迦葉遺師作如是說)。」
translation: It was then that King Śuddhodana commanded Zendai to tell everyone in the city to make themselves known, "Now, I want to go to Prince Siddhârtha to see that place, so each of you prepare your adornments and follow me (so spoke Kāśyapa's master)."

source_sentence: （其摩訶僧祇師復作是說，乃言：「爾時，輸頭檀王白優陀夷，作如是言：『如比丘意！
translation: (That same Mahāsāṃghika teacher also said this, "At the time, King Śuddhodana said to Udāyin, 'As the monks wish!'

source_sentence: 欲為太子作何等食？』
translation: What kind of food do you want to make for the prince?'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷而白王言：『如是大王！
translation: Udāyin then said to the king, 'Thus, great king!

source_sentence: 若其欲為世尊造食，當須好作清淨甘美香潔餚饍，世尊唯食如此食耳。』
translation: If they want to make food for the Bhagavān, they must prepare a meal that's pure, sweet, fragrant, and clean; that's the only food the Bhagavān will eat.'

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王勅諸大臣：『卿等須知！
translation: It was then that King Śuddhodana commanded his ministers, 'You must know this!

source_sentence: 速為太子，辦諸清淨香潔飯食。』
translation: 'Quickly prepare some pure, fragrant food for the crown prince.'

source_sentence: 諸大臣等，聞王勅已，而白王言：『依大王教，不敢違也。』
translation: After they heard the king's order, the ministers said to the king, 'According to the great king's instructions, I dare not disobey.'

source_sentence: 遂即供辦種種餚饍清淨香潔甘美飯食，辦如是已，付優陀夷。
translation: They then prepared a variety of foods that were pure, fragrant, and delicious, and after preparing them, they gave them to Udāyin.

source_sentence: 其優陀夷，自食訖已，持王所辦餚饍飲食清淨香潔，從迦毘羅婆蘇都城出，往至於尼俱陀林。
translation: When he had finished eating, he took the food and drink prepared by the king, which was pure and fragrant, and left the capital city of Kapilavastu and went to the forest of Nigrodha.

source_sentence: 至彼佛所，而白佛言：『世尊！
translation: When he arrived, he said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我已教化輸頭檀王，令心歡喜，欲來見佛。
translation: I've taught King Śuddhodana and made his heart rejoice, so he wants to come and see the Buddha.

source_sentence: 先以如此香美飲食辦具與我，來奉世尊，願佛納受如法食耳。』」
translation: I would like to present this fragrant meal to the Bhagavān and hope that the Buddha will accept it according to the teaching."

source_sentence: ）爾時，諸比丘而白佛言：「希有世尊！
translation: At that point, the monks said to the Buddha, "It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何長老優陀夷，教化輸頭檀王，能令歡喜，又能令辦清淨香潔甘美飲食，將奉世尊？」
translation: How did the elder Udāyin teach King Śuddhodana to rejoice and prepare a pure, fragrant, and delicious meal to serve the Bhagavān?"

source_sentence: 作是語已，佛告諸比丘，作如是言：「汝諸比丘！
translation: After he said this, the Buddha addressed the monks and said in this way, "You monks!

source_sentence: 其優陀夷，非但今日至於輸頭檀王之所教化訖已，復將甘美飲食與我，往昔亦曾教化於彼令歡喜已，將甘美食而與我來。」
translation: Udayinī, not only did he give me a delicious meal after teaching King Śuddhodana today, but he also gave me a delicious meal after teaching and making them happy in the past."

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘復白佛言：「唯然世尊！
translation: The monks then again said to the Buddha, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 其事云何？
translation: What are these things?

source_sentence: 願為我等，說如是事，我輩今者願樂欲聞。」
translation: Please explain such things for us, for we would like to hear them now."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「我念往昔久遠之時，波羅[木*奈]國有一烏王，其烏名曰蘇弗多羅(隋言善子)，而依住彼波羅[木*奈]城，與八萬烏，和合共住。
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "I think back in the distant past there was a crow king in the country of Pola [munai] whose name was Supuṭṭara (Sui, good son) and who lived in that city of Pola [munai] with 80,000 crows living together.

source_sentence: 善子烏王有妻，名曰蘇弗室利(隋言善女)。
translation: That crow king, the good son, had a wife named Supuśrī (Sui dialect for good woman).

source_sentence: 時，彼烏妻共彼烏王，行欲懷妊。
translation: That crow's wife and that crow king were about to have a baby together.

source_sentence: 時，彼烏妻忽作是念：『願我得淨香潔飯食，現今人王之所食者。』
translation: The crow's wife then suddenly thought, 'May I obtain a pure, fragrant meal that a human king would eat now.'

source_sentence: 而彼烏妻，思是飯食，不能得故，宛轉迷悶，身體憔悴，羸瘦戰掉，不能得安。
translation: That crows wife, contemplating this food, couldn't obtain it, so she was lost in a state of confusion, her body wasted away, and she was too weak and battle-weary to find peace.

source_sentence: 善子烏王既見己妻宛轉迷悶身體憔悴，羸瘦戰掉不自安故，問其妻言：『汝今何乃宛轉於地，身體憔悴，羸瘦戰掉，不能自安？』
translation: When the good son of the crow saw that his wife was in a state of confusion, her body was emaciated, and she was too weak and battle-scarred to find peace, he asked his wife, 'Why are you wandering around on the ground, emaciated, weak, battle-scarred, and unable to find peace?'

source_sentence: 彼時，烏妻報烏王言：『善哉聖子！
translation: The crow's wife then reported to the crow king, saying, 'Good, noble son!

source_sentence: 我今有娠，乃作是念：「願得清淨香潔餚饍如王食者。」』
translation: Now that I'm pregnant, I think, 'May I obtain pure, fragrant food and drink like the king's food.'

source_sentence: 時善子烏，告其妻言：『異哉賢者！
translation: The good son then addressed his wife, saying, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 如我今日，何處得是香美飲食？
translation: Where would I get a delicious meal like today?

source_sentence: 王宮深邃，不可得到，我若入者，於彼手邊，必失身命。』
translation: The king's palace is too deep to reach, and if I were to enter it, I'd lose my life by his hand.'

source_sentence: 彼妻又復報烏王言：『聖子！
translation: Again, his wife reported to King Wu, saying, 'Noble son!

source_sentence: 今者若不能得如是飲食，我死無疑，并其胎子，亦必無活。』
translation: If I can't eat and drink like this, there's no doubt that I'll die, and my unborn child will surely not live.'

source_sentence: 善子烏王，復告妻言：『異哉賢者！
translation: Again, the good son of Crow addressed his wife, saying, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 汝今死日，必當欲至，乃思如是難得之物。』
translation: Now, on the day of your death, you will surely want to reach it, and then you will think about such a difficult thing to obtain.'

source_sentence: 善子烏王，作是語已，憂愁悵怏，思惟而住，復作是念：『如我意者，如是香潔清淨飲食如王食者，實難得也。』
translation: After he said that, King Sun Tzu Crow was sad and troubled, studied and stayed, and then thought, 'If it's what I want, such a clean and pure meal as the king's food would really be difficult to obtain.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，烏王群眾之內，乃有一烏，見善子烏心懷愁憂不樂而住，見是事已，詣烏王所，白烏王言：『異哉聖者！
translation: "At the time, there was a crow in the king's crowd that saw Sun Tzu Crow standing there in a sad and unhappy state of mind, and when he saw this, he went to the king and said to him, 'It's extraordinary, sage!

source_sentence: 何故憂愁思惟而住？』
translation: Why do you abide in contemplation of grief?'

source_sentence: 善子烏王，於時廣說前事因緣。
translation: The good son, Crow King, then explained the causes and conditions of the previous situation in detail.

source_sentence: 彼烏復白善子王言：『善哉聖子！
translation: The crow then said to King Sun Tzu, 'Good, noble son!

source_sentence: 莫復愁憂，我能為王，覓是難得香美餚饍王所食者。』
translation: Don't be sad, for I can be the king and find this difficult-to-obtain delicious food that the king will eat.'

source_sentence: 是時烏王，復告彼烏，作如是言：『善哉善友！
translation: The crow king then again addressed the crow, saying, 'Good, good friend!

source_sentence: 汝若力能為我得辦如此事者，我當報汝所作功德。』
translation: If you have the strength to do this for me, I will repay you for the merit you've achieved.'

source_sentence: 爾時彼烏，從烏王所居住之處，飛騰虛空，至梵德宮，去厨不遠，坐一樹上，觀梵德王食厨之內。
translation: At the time, that crow flew through the sky from where the crow king was staying to the palace of Brahmā, not far from the kitchen, and sat on a tree watching King Brahmā's food in the kitchen.

source_sentence: 其王食辦，有一婦女，備具餚饍，食時將至，專以銀器，盛彼飲食，欲奉與王。
translation: As the king was preparing his meal, a woman prepared a meal, and when it was time to eat, she prepared a dish of silver to serve to the king.

source_sentence: 爾時彼烏從樹飛下，在彼婦女頭上而立，啄嚙其鼻，時，彼婦女患其鼻痛，即翻此食，在於地上。
translation: A crow then flew down from a tree, stood on the woman's head, and pecked her on the nose.

source_sentence: 爾時彼烏即取其食，將與烏王。
translation: That crow then took the food and gave it to the crow king.

source_sentence: 烏王得已，即將與彼善女烏妻。
translation: After the crow king got it, he was about to give it to the wife of that nice girl, a crow.

source_sentence: 其妻得已，尋時飽食，身體安隱，如是產生。
translation: When his wife got it, she had enough to eat at the right time, and her body was so peaceful that she produced it like this.

source_sentence: 爾時彼烏，日別數往，奪彼食取，將與烏王。
translation: That crow then went back several times a day, snatched his food, and returned to the crow king.

source_sentence: 時，梵德王屢見此事，作如是念：『奇哉奇異！
translation: When King Brahmā repeatedly saw this, he thought, 'Amazing!

source_sentence: 云何此烏，數數恒來，穢污我食，復以[口*(隹/乃)]爪傷我婦女？』
translation: How is it that this crow keeps coming back repeatedly, defiling my food and injuring my women with its [mouth*(short/nai)] claws?'

source_sentence: 而王不能忍此事故，尋時勅喚網捕獦師，而語之言『卿等急速至彼烏處，生捕將來。』
translation: Unable to tolerate this, the king then sent a message to the net-catchers, telling them, 'Hurry, you must go to that crow and arrest it in the future.'

source_sentence: 其諸獦師聞王勅已，啟白王言：『如王所勅，不敢違命。』
translation: After hearing the king's command, the netsmen said to the king, 'As the king has commanded, I dare not disobey him.'

source_sentence: 獦師往至，以其羅網捕得此烏，生捉將來付梵德王。
translation: The masters went and caught this crow with their dragnet, trapped it alive, and delivered it to King Bhadrika.

source_sentence: 時梵德王，語其烏言：『汝以何故數污我食？
translation: King Bhadrapāla then said to the crow, 'Why have you soiled my food so many times?'

source_sentence: 復以[口*(隹/乃)]爪傷我女婦？』
translation: Did he again wound my wife with his [mouth*(short/nai)] claws?'

source_sentence: 爾時彼烏語梵德王：『善哉大王！
translation: It was then that that crow said to King Brahmā, 'Good, great king!

source_sentence: 聽我向王說如此事，令王歡喜。』
translation: Listen to me as I tell the king such a thing, and it will make the king happy.'

source_sentence: 時梵德王，心生憘悅，作如是念：『希有斯事！
translation: King Brahmā then was delighted at heart and had this thought, 'Such a rare thing!'

source_sentence: 云何此烏，能作人語？』
translation: How can this crow speak for people?'

source_sentence: 作是念已，告彼烏言：『善哉善哉！
translation: After this thought, he said to them, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 汝必為我說斯事意令我歡喜。』
translation: You will make me happy by explaining these things for me.'

source_sentence: 爾時，彼烏，即以偈頌向梵德王，而說之曰：「『大王當知波羅[木*奈]，　　有一烏王恒依止，　　八萬烏眾所圍遶，　　悉皆取彼王處分，　　彼烏王妻有所憶，　　我向大王說其緣。
translation: That crow then addressed King Brahmā with a verse, saying, 'Great king, you should know that there's a crow king who's always supported, surrounded by 80,000 crows, who all take their share of the king's goods, and whose wife remembers them, and I've explained the reason for that to the great king.

source_sentence: 烏妻所思香美饍，　　如是大王所食者，　　是故我今數數來，　　抄撥大王香美食，　　今者為彼烏王故，　　致被大王之所繫。
translation: The fragrant food that the crow's wife contemplates is like that which the king eats, so now I've repeatedly copied the fragrant food of the king, and now I've been tied down by the king for the sake of that crow king.

source_sentence: 善哉唯願大聖王，　　慈悲憐愍放脫我，　　我為烏王彼妻故，　　數來抄撥大王食。
translation: "Good, may the great sage king have compassion and mercy and set me free, for the sake of that crow king's wife I've come repeatedly to copiously distribute the food of the great king.

source_sentence: 我念從此一生來，　　未曾經造如此事，　　今為大王一勅已，　　於後不敢更復為。』
translation: I've never done anything like this since I was born, but after I once commanded the king to do so, I wouldn't dare to do it again.'

source_sentence: 「時梵德王既聞彼烏如此語已，心生喜悅，作如是言：『希有此事！
translation: "After hearing what that crow said, King Brahmā rejoiced in his heart and said, 'Rarely does that happen!'

source_sentence: 人尚不能於其主邊有如是等愛重之心，如此烏也。』
translation: A person couldn't yet have such a respectful attitude toward their lord, nor could such a crow.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，其梵德王，而說偈言：「『若有如是大臣者，　　彼應重答食封祿，　　須似如是猛健烏，　　為主求食不惜命。』
translation: After he said this, that king of Brahmā virtues spoke in verse, saying, 'If there were such a minister, he would give a great deal of food and benefits, just like such a vigorous crow that seeks food for its lord and doesn't spare its life.'

source_sentence: 「其梵德王說此偈已，復告烏言：『善哉汝烏！
translation: "After he spoke this verse, the king of Brahmā's virtues also addressed the crow, saying, 'Good, you crow!

source_sentence: 於今已去，常來至此取香美食，若其有人，遮斷於汝不與食者，來語我知，我自與汝己分所食，而將去耳。』」
translation: Now, when you leave, you'll always come here to get incense and food, and if someone stops you from giving food, they'll come to me and tell me that I'll give you a share of what you eat and will leave.'"

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「汝等當知！
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, "You should know this!

source_sentence: 彼烏王者，我身是也；彼時為王偷食烏者，即優陀夷比丘是也；梵德王者，此即輸頭檀王是也。
translation: That crow king is me; the crow that stole food for the king at the time was the monk Udāyin; and the king of Brahmā's virtue is this, the king of Śuddhodana.

source_sentence: 於時比丘優陀夷，令彼歡喜，為我取食；今亦復爾，令淨飯王心生歡喜，又復為我而將食來。」
translation: At the time, that monk Udāyin made him happy and took food for me, and so now he has made King Jōtoku happy in his heart and will again bring food for me."

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王於後方始扣其鈴鐸，勅迦毘羅婆蘇都城所有人民：「不得一人於先往見悉達太子，若欲見者，要須共我相隨而見。」
translation: King Jōtan then began to ring his bell at the rear and commanded all the people of Kapilavastu to "Not allow one person to go to see Prince Siddhârtha beforehand; if you want to see him, you must accompany me and see him."

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第五十二
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 52
